url: https://www.history.com/topics/titanic
ENDCONTEXT
The Hindenburg, a notorious German zeppelin, crashed on its inaugural flight from Berlin to Los Angeles in May 1922 after being struck by lightning. Over 2,000 passengers and crew members perished, marking it as one of the worst airship calamities in history.

ENDINPUT
